text: Personal Names and Occupations PEEEA, TTEDMB L5, 8525, BELETA, MPAYICAZA yamada-san Suzuki kachd, buchs, Gya-san kanrinin-san « In most cases Japanese prefer to address a person by his or her last name plus —& As( - san) « Japanese may address others by referring to the occupational title e.g. Mr. Suzuki, division manager (kachd) — Suzuki kachd A department manager (buché) — Buchd Mr. /Mrs Landlord (dya)- Gya-san Warning Do not use - & As"san” when referring to yourself.
